fields.headline: Events: Manchester Literature Festival
fields.bodyText: With walking tours aplenty and an interesting variety of venues, this festival makes use of the urban environment to marry words with place and mark itself out from the myriad literary events that have sprung up in recent years. Of course, it is still big names that will attract the bulk of the audience. Here you get Kate Mosse, Val McDermid, Jimmy McGovern and Fay Weldon. Gentlemen of a certain age will find it hard to resist afternoon tea with Joan Bakewell and the festival bows out with a weekend dedicated to exploring the short story, including tales inspired by Darwin and the Smiths. Various venues, Thu to 25 Oct, manchester literaturefestival.co.uk
